contextId.occurrenceNote: To "anoint" is a symbolic act to show that they recognized that God had chosen David as king. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: They anointed David king over Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: The angel holding a sword in his hand is a symbolic action that shows he is ready to attack Jerusalem. This is symbolic, because the judgment was sickness. Alternate translation: "holding a sword in his hand as if ready to attack Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: having a drawn sword in his hand raised over Jerusalem
clothed in sackcloth, lay facedown on the ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase describes that Ornan bowed far forward. To bow before someone is a way to show humility and respect. A deeper bow shows greater humility and respect. Alternate translation: "bowed very low to the ground" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: with his face to the ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: The angel putting his sword back in the sheath is a symbolic action to show that he would not continue to kill the people. Alternate translation: the angel put his sword in its sheath to show that he would stop killing the people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: the angel put his sword back into its sheath

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to laying down on the ground before someone to show great respect. Alternate translation: "prostrated themselves on the ground to show respect to Yahweh and the king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
